data.title: Springfield Primary School
data.meta_description: School Ratings for Springfield Primary School, Orchard Street, Kempston, Bedford, Bedfordshire, MK42 7LJ. This school was rated Good by Ofsted in September 2022. For it's latest set of KS2 results 25 percent of students met the expected standard in Reading, Writing and Maths and 4 percent of students met the higher standard.
data.text:
Average Scaled Score

Results are converted into scaled scores to allow accurate comparisons of performance over time even if the difficulty of the test varies over time. Scaled scores range from 80 to 120.

Subject School Percentile (local) Percentile (nationwide) Reading 99 Unlock Unlock Maths 100 Unlock Unlock

Progress Scores

A progress score is a way to measure how well a student progressed in comparison to other students of a similar starting ability. A score of zero means would mean that a student made the same progress as others that had a similar starting a ability. A positive score would mean that the student made more progress than other students of similar starting ability. The scores below are for the whole school so is the average progress score across all students.

Metric School Score Percentile (local) Percentile (nationwide) Reading -3.5 Unlock Unlock Writing -2.6 Unlock Unlock Maths -2.8 Unlock Unlock

Results are converted into scaled scores to allow accurate comparisons of performance over time even if the difficulty of the test varies over time. Scaled scores range from 80 to 120.

Note: Exam results were not published in 2020, 2021 or 2022 due to the pandemic.
